Lines are forming in front of each pot, with people in line each carrying a paper chili bowl, but holding back, deferring to the JUDGES. dialogue.raw_text: Reading from the rules, "...in the event of a tie at the end of three heats in the surf competition, the teams who are tied will participate in a sudden-death surf off. Additional heats will be run until a winner can be declared." (looking up at the crowd) The "Sudden Death" heat will begin in five minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: takes a quarter out of his pocket and points to COWBOY to call it. It lands and the JUDGE looks at it. HE points to ROBBIE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EXT -MOMENTS LATER - AOKEE'S SURF & SNACK SHACK                70 Page 75 of 81 ROBBIE, ALEX, AOKEE and PIPEMAN have gathered in front of AOKEE's to strategize.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You want to go first or second?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Second.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be ready in five minutes. 70
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what you do?   Wait for him to go crazy and fall?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't want to win with him falling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could always go out and do your very best, take a lot of chances and maybe win this thing on merit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dismissive) Don't be silly. That only works in the movies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes his head) Actually, that's exactly what I'm thinking. It's the reason we're in a tie. I've been too conservative. I've got to do everything I can, or just forget about it. It's all or nothing. (pause) We gotta pull the fin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pull da fin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think you can hold it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (explaining) One time, these tourists from Japan on the beach at La Jolla offered me a hundred bucks to do a full spin at the top of the wave, and then slide down and cut back and do a full back flip. I pulled it off. A friend of mine had a tricks board with just a single fin and foot pockets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We gotta pull the fin. What do we do about the foot pockets?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got duct tape?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reaches into his tool belt and pulls out a roll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They place the board on a table. ROBBIE pulls off two small pieces of tape and places them on the board.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of plumber would I be if I didn't have duct tape? Water World Page 76 of 81 Platinum!   Where do you want them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here and here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: gets his screw gun out of his tool belt and begins removing the two outer fins of the board. He then begins looping duct tap around the board to create two foot pockets. This provides a background to the dialog below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you do now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear an air horn blast.      They are ready to start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands Robbie the board. ALEX heads back to the bleachers area, PIPEMAN goes to the pumphouse in back of Thunder Bay.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So, help me understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pipeman is taking the extra fins off my board. I only need one to make a deep cut back. He is also putting some pockets to slip my feet into so when I flip upside down, I don't lose the board.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Flip upside down?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A back flip. You guys see it on snowboarders here all the time, I'm sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah, I'm sure I did that last winter. But not on purpose! Dude. You're either gonna win this thing or you're gonna die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quickly, eagerly) It would be better if you won.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well, a tie is like kissing your sister.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mock anger) You stay away from my sister.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ready!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to PIPEMAN) I'll need the biggest wave you can give me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (imitating Mr. Scott on Star Page 77 of 81 Trek) I'll give 'er all she's got, Cap'n!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: hangs back with ROBBIE and speaks to him alone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (dropping his Hawaiian accent) Robbie. When you do this, do this mostly for Robbie Zirpollo. But do it just a little bit for Manny Ramirez, eh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: smiles and pats him on the back.    Robbie nods.    They head for the bay. 71        EXT. MORNING - MOMENTS LATER - THUNDER BAY                       71 COWBOY is in the water paddling out to get his wave. It comes and he has apparently decided to stay with what has gotten him this far; a conservative style that keeps him looking good without falling. His ride is similar to the last one, but even more graceful and lyrical and he gets a 9.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to ROBBIE) Looks like he's waiting for you to make a mistake. You sure you know what you're doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm just making this up as I go along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Works for me! Go get 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: appears on the seawall holding his board and looking out first at the bay, then at the crowd. His mom, CONNIE waves, and he smiles weakly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sees KATIE and she looks hopeful. She hasn't given up on him completely. He smiles at her and gets into the water. He begins paddling. It seems to take forever for him to get out to the spot where he catches the wave, but he finally arrives. He sits there for a moment, collecting himself, then raises his hand to signal he is ready. The CONCESSIONS KIDS have started to chant, ROBBIE! ROBBIE! The guards are anxious, but even they can't help moving to the cadence of the chant. The wave comes and he catches it quickly, and slips his feet into the duct tape pockets. He misses one pocket at first, then gets it in. He rides it carefully and at the right moment slides up to Page 78 of 81 the top and executes a full 360 degree turn out of the water. On landing back on the downside of the wave, he slides down it quickly, and then turns around with a deep cut and heads straight into the wave. At the top he bounces and does a complete back flip in slow motion. We see the crowd also in slow motion. AOKEE Is covering his eyes, he can't watch. ALEX's face is contorted with disbelief. Various faces in the crowd are in open-mouthed disbelief. THE JUDGES are staring intently, focussed so as not to miss anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lands the flip, and rides the rest of the wave.      He waves to the crowd, and kicks off, exhausted. The place goes nuts. No one here has ever seen anything like this before. AOKEE and ALEX run into the water and help him out. People are still cheering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knows he's in trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: confer only momentarily and the score 10 appears, and the word concessions starts flashing along with the word winner. COWBOY nods in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: says something to him, and he appears angry.      We can only hear part of his response, something like:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (disbelief) You did WHAT?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and ALEX lead him up to the grandstand. COWBOY also makes his way up there, and we see him talking to BIG MIKE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods in agreement and COWBOY goes to the mike as the crowd settles down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: As last year's Surfer King, it's my privilege to present this year's trophy to the most amazing surfer on the water today. Robbie! Congratulations.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shakes ROBBIE's hand, and ROBBIE speaks at the mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see KATIE clapping, crying.   AOKEE and ALEX are clapping and smiling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (holding trophy) I just want to thank Aokee, Alex and Katie for all their support.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I have just one thing to say to everyone in concessions. WE DID IT!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: holds the trophy high as everyone cheers. Page 79 of 81 FADE TO BLACK. 72        EXT. Awnings are being taken down.     Chairs and tables are being moved. We see JAFFA packing up his CD's into that cardboard box.       HE also snaps the winter covers for the sound equipment into place. 73        EXT. ALEX, ROBBIE, KATIE and AMY are clocking out for the final time this summer. They all stop and look around one final time.     Suddenly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drives up in her convertible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They could use your help. They all walk closer to her car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Another summer gone. How about it Robbie? You gonna guard next year?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know...we have a pretty good time at AOKEE's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, that's what I hear. Maybe I should work there next summer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and AMY all say these lines pretty much at the same time.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You wouldn't like it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's a bad idea...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you're such a good guard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'd be miserable...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe you're right.    See you around...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: appears out of the time shack wearing his tuxedo t shirt. Page 80 of 81 EDDIE (almost singing) Tiffany! He walks up to her driver's side.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (feeling charitable, warmly) Hello, Eddie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shows there is nothing in his hands, then reaches into the car and from behind TIFFANY's ear pulls a plastic Easter Egg out. He hands it to her, and she opens it. A beautiful butterfly flies out and away. She is momentarily entranced.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know, that's one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen. (pause, thinking, what the heck) Hop in Eddie, let me give you a ride home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: waves his hand for HER to scoot over so he can drive. She is surprised, but does, almost reflexively. He gets in and he looks at ALEX, ROBBIE, KATIE and AMY grinning broadly as he pulls away.
